intro: Dasygrammitis brevivenosa, commonly known as the short-veined fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, small fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant has a dense network of veins, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Dasygrammitis. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its small size and intricate structure, it is a popular subject for botanists and enthusiasts studying fern morphology.
